v.v: Then Job answered and said,
“Oh, if only my anguish were weighed;
For now it would be heavier than the sand of the seas.
For the arrows of the Almighty are in me,
Does the wild donkey bray in despair when he has grass?
Can that which has no taste be eaten without salt?
I refuse to touch them;
Oh, that I might have my request;
that it would please God to crush me once,
May this still be my consolation—
What is my strength, that I should try to wait?
Is my strength the strength of stones?
Is it not true that I have no help in myself,
To the person who is about to faint, faithfulness should be shown by his friend;
But my brothers have been as faithful to me as a desert streambed,
which are darkened because of ice over them,
When they thaw out, they vanish;
The caravans that travel by their way turn aside for water;
Caravans from Tema looked there,
They were disappointed because they had been confident of finding water.
For now you friends are nothing to me;
Did I say to you, ‘Give something to me’
or, ‘Save me from my adversary’s hand’
Teach me, and I will hold my peace;
How painful are truthful words!
Do you plan to ignore
Indeed, you cast lots for a fatherless child,
Now, therefore, please look at me,
Relent, I beg you; let there be no injustice with you;
Is there evil on my tongue?

v: if only all my calamity were laid in the balance!
That is why my words were reckless.
my spirit drinks up the poison;
the terrors of God have arranged themselves in array against me.
Or does the ox low in hunger when it has fodder?
Or is there any taste in the white of an egg?
they are like disgusting food to me.
oh, that God would grant me the thing I long for:
that he would let loose his hand and cut me off from this life!
even if I exult in pain that does not lessen:
that I have not denied the words of the Holy One.
What is my end, that I should prolong my life?
Or is my flesh made of bronze?
and that wisdom has been driven out of me?
even to him who forsakes the fear of the Almighty.
as channels of water that pass away to nothing,
and because of the snow that hides itself in them.
when it is hot, they melt out of their place.
they wander into barren land and then perish.
while companies of Sheba hoped in them.
They went there, but they were deceived.
you see my dreadful situation and are afraid.
or, ‘Offer me a gift from your wealth’
or, ‘Ransom me from the hand of my oppressors’?
make me understand where I have been wrong.
But your arguments, how do they actually rebuke me?
treating the words of a desperate man like the wind?
and haggle over your friend like merchandise.
for surely I would not lie to your face.
Indeed, relent, for my cause is just.
Cannot my mouth detect malicious things?
